intro: Koeleria ventanicola, commonly known as the slender grass vetch, is a flowering plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing minute blue or purple flowers. It is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Koeleria ventanicola plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment and is of interest to botanists studying high-altitude flora.
